item.title: Laura add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "The best remedy for those who are afraid, lonely or unhappy is to go outside, somewhere where they can be quite alone with the heavens, nature and God. Because only then does one feel that all is as it should be and that God wishes to see people happy, amidst the simple beauty of nature. As longs as this exists, and it certainly always will, I know that then there will always be comfort for every sorrow, whatever the circumstances may be. And I firmly believe that nature brings solace in all troubles." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "[Kids] don't remember what you try to teach them. They remember what you are." -- Jim Henson

item.title: Laura add a quote by Steve Maraboli
item.description: "What we instill in our children will be the foundation upon which they build their future." -- Steve Maraboli

item.title: Laura add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Laura add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "It is not that I'm so smart. But I stay with the questions much longer." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Laura add a quote by Bram Stoker
item.description: "We learn from failure, not from success!" -- Bram Stoker

item.title: Laura add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "I’ve seen how you can’t learn anything when you’re trying to look like the smartest person in the room." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Laura add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "There was no solution, save that universal solution which life gives to all questions, even the most complex and insolvable: One must live in the needs of the day--that is, forget oneself." -- Leo Tolstoy
